questions: When is the next graduation ceremony?
Can I attend the graduation ceremony as a guest?
Is there a live stream available for the graduation ceremony?
How can I get an invitation to the graduation ceremony?
Tell me more about the dress code for the graduation ceremony.
What time does the graduation ceremony start?
Where is the graduation ceremony venue?
How many graduates are expected at the next ceremony?
Can I bring my family to the graduation ceremony?
Are there any special guests or speakers at the graduation ceremony?
responses: The next graduation ceremony is scheduled for 17 Nov, 2023, from 8:30 am to 1:00 pm at Visa Oshwal Community Centre.
We invite all stakeholders, friends, and family to join us in celebrating the achievements of our graduates.
There will be a live stream link for those unable to attend in person.
Invitations will be sent to stakeholders, friends, and family. You can contact us for more information.
The dress code is casual formal. Avoid rugged jeans, shorts, and tights for a respectful atmosphere.
The graduation ceremony starts at 8:30 am and concludes at 1:00 pm.
The venue for the graduation ceremony is Visa Oshwal Community Centre.
We expect approximately 996 graduates at the upcoming ceremony.
You can bring your family to share in the celebration.
We will have special guests and speakers to make the ceremony memorable.

questions: What is the duration of the Part-time Software Engineering course?
What programming languages are covered in the Full Stack Software Engineering Curriculum?
Are there any prerequisites for enrolling in the Software Engineering program?
How much time should I dedicate to learning each week?
Tell me about the hands-on learning experience in the Software Engineering program.
Can I work while enrolled in the Software Engineering program?
What support is provided for job placement after completing the program?
Is financial aid available for the Software Engineering program?
Are there any group projects in the Software Engineering program?
How is the curriculum structured?
Can I apply if I have no prior coding experience?
responses: The course duration is 30 weeks.
The curriculum covers HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, SQL, Python, JSON, and Redux Frameworks.
No prior coding knowledge is required. The program is designed for beginners and experienced learners alike.
Students are required to dedicate 6 days to learning, with 20-25 hours per week, including 3 live lectures and additional helpdesk support on Saturdays.
The program offers practical hands-on learning with real-world projects to enhance your skills.
While the program is intensive, some students find a balance with part-time work.
We provide career coaching and job-hunting support for up to 12 months post-graduation.
Candidates can take a student loan, paying N90,720 as a commitment fee and the remaining balance after securing a job.
Group projects are a key component, fostering collaboration and practical application of skills.
The curriculum is structured to cover both front-end and back-end development technologies.
Absolutely! The program is designed to accommodate learners with no prior coding experience.

questions: What specific technologies will I learn in the Full Stack Software Engineering Curriculum?
Tell me more about the hands-on labs and projects included in the curriculum.
How is version control covered in the course?
What is the significance of learning both front-end and back-end technologies?
Can you provide details on the instructor-led technical mentorship sessions?
What is the structure of the large-scale group project at the end of the program?
Are there any additional resources provided for further learning?
Can I access course materials after completing the program?
How does the curriculum prepare students for real-world challenges?
What kind of coding assignments can I expect in the course?
answers: The curriculum includes HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, SQL, Python, Flask, JSON, and Redux Frameworks.
Hands-on labs and projects are designed to simulate real-world scenarios and enhance practical skills.
Version control using git commands, including cloning, branching, merging, rolling back commits, forking, and submitting pull requests, is covered.
Learning both front-end and back-end technologies prepares you to become a versatile full-stack developer, capable of handling end-to-end development.
Technical mentorship sessions include 1:1s with your instructor to work on technical concepts, plan out your pacing, or check-in about your program milestones.
The large-scale group project at the end of the program is guided by your technical instructor and involves diving deep into various advanced technologies.
Additional resources, labs, and real-world portfolio development are part of the program to support further learning.
You can access course materials after completing the program for ongoing reference.
The curriculum is designed to present challenges similar to those faced in real-world software engineering, preparing you for professional scenarios.
Coding assignments range from basic exercises to complex projects, ensuring a comprehensive learning experience.

questions: What programming languages are covered in the Part-Time Software Engineering Course?
How does the part-time course differ from the full-time course in terms of duration?
Can I join live lectures or watch recordings based on my schedule?
What are the pacing options available for part-time students?
Is there a difference in the curriculum between the part-time and full-time courses?
How does the part-time course accommodate working professionals?
Are there hands-on labs and real-world projects in the part-time course?
Can part-time students access technical mentorship and career coaching?
What is the pricing structure for the part-time course?
Is there alumni support provided after completing the part-time course?
answers: The Part-Time Software Engineering Course covers HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, SQL, Python, Flask, JSON, and Redux Frameworks.
The part-time course has a duration of 30 weeks, providing a more flexible schedule for learners.
Students can either join live lectures or watch recordings based on their schedule, ensuring flexibility.
Part-time students engage in 20-25 hours of learning per week, including one 3-hour lecture and additional support on Saturdays.
While the core curriculum is similar, the part-time course is adapted to accommodate a longer duration and provide flexibility for working professionals.
The part-time course is designed to accommodate working professionals, allowing them to balance learning with other commitments.
Hands-on labs, real-world projects, and a large-scale group project are integral parts of the part-time course.
Part-time students have access to 1:1 technical mentorship and career coaching for up to 12 months post-graduation.
The cost of the part-time course is USD 2,000 (Ksh 200,000), with installment plans available.
Part-time students can enjoy up to 12 months of alumni support from the Career Services Department after graduation.

questions: Can you provide details on the hands-on labs and real-world projects included in the part-time course?
How is version control covered in the part-time course?
What is the structure of the large-scale group project at the end of the part-time course?
How does the part-time course prepare students for real-world challenges?

How is the part-time course structured to cover both front-end and back-end technologies?
Can part-time students access course materials after completing the program?
answers: Hands-on labs and real-world projects in the part-time course simulate real-world scenarios and enhance practical skills.
Version control using git commands, including cloning, branching, merging, rolling back commits, forking, and submitting pull requests, is covered.
The large-scale group project at the end of the part-time course is guided by a technical instructor, providing an opportunity to dive deep into advanced technologies.
The part-time course is designed to present challenges similar to those faced in real-world software engineering, preparing students for professional scenarios.
Additional resources, labs, and real-world portfolio development are part of the part-time course to support further learning.
Coding assignments in the part-time course range from basic exercises to complex projects, ensuring a comprehensive learning experience.
The part-time course balances theoretical concepts with practical skills through a combination of lectures, labs, and projects.
Part-time students have flexibility in their schedule, with the option to join live lectures or watch recordings based on their availability.
The part-time course is structured to cover both front-end and back-end technologies, providing a comprehensive full-stack learning experience.
Part-time students can access course materials after completing the program for ongoing reference.

questions: What is the duration of the Software Engineering Mobile Track?
Who is the ideal candidate for this mobile development course?
Can you provide an overview of the curriculum and technologies covered?
How is the learning experience structured for mobile development students?
What career opportunities are available after completing the mobile track?
Is there flexibility in the pacing options for the course?
Can you elaborate on the role of QA testers in mobile app development?
How do mobile developers use frameworks like React Native?
What are the prerequisites for enrolling in the course?
How does the course prepare students for real-world mobile development projects?
answers: The duration of the course is 23 weeks.
The ideal candidates are aspiring mobile app developers, junior developers, IT professionals, and entrepreneurs.
The curriculum covers JavaScript, React Native, MongoDB, Node.js, Express framework, and RESTful API.
The learning experience includes project-based learning, technical mentor support, and interactive workshops.
Job opportunities include roles such as mobile app developers, QA testers, and mobile product managers.
There are flexible installment plans available for the course.
QA testers are responsible for testing mobile apps to identify and report bugs, usability issues, and performance problems.
Cross-platform developers use frameworks like React Native to build applications for both Android and iOS with a single codebase.
Prerequisites include basic computer skills, proficiency in English, and access to stable internet.
The course combines theoretical understanding with practical application, preparing students for real-world mobile development challenges.

questions: Tell me more about the partnership between Moringa School and Impact Hub Accra.
What benefits does the partnership offer to students?
How can students get involved in collaborative projects through the partnership?
Are there any events or workshops organized as part of the partnership?
Can students from other regions participate in the Impact Hub Accra partnership?
Who are the key individuals involved in the partnership?
What is the goal of the collaboration between Moringa School and Impact Hub Accra?
How does the partnership contribute to the overall learning experience?
Are there any internship opportunities through the partnership?
Can students access resources at Impact Hub Accra during the program?
responses: The partnership aims to foster collaboration and support for tech education. Key individuals involved include Nelly Agyemang-Gyamfi, Kelechi Victor Ofoegbu, and Setriakor Nyomi.
The partnership provides additional networking opportunities, access to resources, and collaborative projects for students.
Students can engage in collaborative projects by expressing interest and participating in events organized through the partnership.
Various events and workshops are organized as part of the partnership to enrich the student experience.
While the physical hub is in Accra, the partnership offers opportunities for remote collaboration, allowing students from other regions to participate.
The goal is to nurture African talent, advance tech in Africa, and create opportunities for students through collaborative projects.
The collaboration enhances the overall learning experience by providing real-world exposure and industry connections.
Internship opportunities may arise through the partnership, providing valuable industry experience for students.
Students can access resources at Impact Hub Accra, contributing to a rich and supportive learning environment.
Absolutely! The partnership creates opportunities for students to immerse themselves in a broader tech community.

questions: How can I reach the Admissions team?
What is the email address for general inquiries?
Is there a WhatsApp contact for inquiries?
Can I visit the Ngong Lane Plaza in person for assistance?
What are the office hours for contacting the admissions team?
How soon can I expect a response to my email inquiry?
Is there a dedicated helpline for urgent matters?
Can I schedule a campus tour?
What social media channels can I use to connect with Moringa School?
Are there local offices or representatives for international inquiries?
responses: You can reach the Admissions team through the official Moringa School website or by emailing admissions@moringaschool.com.
For general inquiries, you can contact info@moringaschool.com.
You can contact the admissions team via WhatsApp at +254 798 123 852.
You can visit Ngong Lane Plaza in person for assistance. The address is Ngong Lane Plaza, 4th Floor, Ngong Lane, Nairobi, Kenya.
The office hours for contacting the admissions team are Monday to Friday, 9:00 am to 5:00 pm.
We strive to respond to email inquiries within 24-48 hours.
For urgent matters, you can contact the dedicated helpline at +254 798 123 852.
You can schedule a campus tour through the official Moringa School website.
Connect with Moringa School on social media through Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and Instagram.
For international inquiries, you can reach out to our local offices or representatives who will provide assistance.
